thread.title: Liverpool confident of Aubameyang & Klopp reunion: West Ham buying Sturridge to fund deal
thread.title_full: Liverpool confident of Aubameyang & Klopp reunion: West Ham buying Sturridge to fund deal

title: Liverpool confident of Aubameyang & Klopp reunion: West Ham buying Sturridge to fund deal
text:
Liverpool confident of Aubameyang & Klopp reunion: West Ham buying Sturridge to fund deal LIVERPOOL are reportedly confident they can beat Manchester City to the signing of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. PUBLISHED: 22:01, Wed, Feb 8, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:40, Wed, Feb 8, 2017 
The Â£40million-rated striker could leave Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season. 
Aubameyang has often spoken of his desire to join Real Madrid due to his grandfather's wishes. 
But according to The Guardian , the Reds believe the 27-year-old can be lured to Anfield. 
A reunion with former boss Jurgen Klopp would be Liverpool's appeal to the Gabon international, who was signed by the German at Dortmund. GETTY Liverpool are set to try and fund a move for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang by selling Daniel Sturridge Liverpool feel they have a strong chance of landing the Bundesliga star 
Pep Guardiola is also keen on bringing Aubameyang to the Premier League at City. 
The Manchester outfit were close to signing the prolific hitman last summer, and with Sergio Aguero admitting his future is in doubt, City will reignite their pursuit of Aubameyang. 
While Liverpool feel they have a strong chance of landing the Bundesliga star, the club must fund his transfer. 
And it is said the Reds will try to move on Daniel Sturridge in the summer to free up space and funds. GETTY Pep Guardiola would like to bring Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang to Manchester City 10 facts about Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang Tue, February 16, 2016
